greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: In ternary representation: minimal number of editing steps (delete, insert or substitute) to transform n into n^2.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Gilleland, Levenshtein Distance [It has been suggested that this algorithm gives incorrect results sometimes. - _N. J. A. Sloane_]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Square Number
example: a(12)=2: 12->'110', insert a 2 between the 1's and insert a 0 at the end: '12100'->144=12^2.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 18 2003
